description:
Version 1.0. Visualizes PostgreSQL metrics collected by Mamonsu.

Zabbix: https://zabbix.com
Mamonsu: https://github.com/postgrespro/mamonsu

panels.description:
Average number of locks from pg_locks per [$interval] for different query types.

Access share locks - Sum of locks from pg_locks with mode Access Share. Metric describes a total number of locks acquired (or waiting) by queries that only reads tables and do not modify.

item.filter: /total number of locks acquired \(or waiting\) by all queries like (.*)$/
/total number of locks acquired \(or waiting\) by queries that only reads tables and do not modify$/

panels.title: Locks sampling

options.content:
### Memory Leak detection plugin
This plugin allows detects possible memory leaks while working with PostgreSQL using /proc/pid/status and /proc/pid/statm.

This plugin is **disabled** by default. \
To enable the plugin - set *"enabled = True"* in the Mamonsu agent configuration file, section **[memoryleakdiagnostic]**.

We use RES and SHR difference to calculate approximate volume of private anonymous backend memory.
If it exceeds private_anon_mem_threshold then that pid will be added to a message. An example is presented below
statm -  'pid: {pid},  RES {RES} - SHR {SHR} more then {private_anon_mem_threshold}\n'
Since Linux 4.5 RssAnon, RssFile and RssShmem have been added.
They allows to distinguish types of memory such as private anonymous, file-backed, and shared anonymous memory.
We are interested in RssAnon. If its value exceeds private_anon_mem_threshold then that pid will also be added to a message.

panels.description: PostgreSQL Memory Leak: Number of Pids Which Private Anonymous Memory Exceeds private_anon_mem_threshold

item.filter: PostgreSQL Memory Leak: Number of Pids Which Private Anonymous Memory Exceeds private_anon_mem_threshold

panels.title: Number of Pids exceeds private_anon_mem_threshold

panels.description: Can be empty, if there's no memory leaks

item.filter: PostgreSQL Memory Leak: Number of Pids Which Private Anonymous Memory Exceeds private_anon_mem_threshold, text of message

panels.title: Memory Leak plugin message

options.content:
### Relations size
Gets size of specified relations.
If the relation is blocked by some process such as vacuum full or create index, the result will be -1.

This plugin is **disabled** by default. \
To enable the plugin - set *"enabled = True"* in the Mamonsu agent configuration file, section **[relationssize]**.

panels.description: Server Mode shows server status as MASTER or STANDBY.
panels.title: Server mode

panels.description:
Non-active Replication Slots calculates as count of slots with false active status.

Replication metrics use information from pg_replication_slots.

item.filter: PostgreSQL Replication: Count Non-Active Replication Slots

panels.title: Non-Active Replication Slots

panels.description:
Streaming Replication Lag calculates as difference between now and pg_last_xact_replay_timestamp.

Replication metrics use information from pg_replication_slots.
panels.title: Streaming Replication Lag

panels.description: Replication metrics use information from pg_replication_slots.
panels.title: Delta of Total Lag

panels.description:
**Flush Lag** - Time elapsed between flushing recent WAL locally and receiving notification that this standby server has written and flushed it.
	
**Receive Lag** - Time elapsed between receiving recent WAL locally and receiving notification that this standby server has flushed it.

**Replay Lag** - Time elapsed between flushing recent WAL locally and receiving notification that this standby server has written, flushed and applied.

**Send Lag** - Time elapsed sending recent WAL locally.
	
**Write Lag** - Time elapsed between flushing recent WAL locally and receiving notification that this standby server has written it

Replication metrics use information from pg_replication_slots.
panels.title: Lag details

panels.description:
Amount of WAL Files maps wal_bytes.

Statements metrics use information from pg_stat_statements and pg_stat_statements_info for PostgreSQL cluster and from pgpro_stats extension for PostgresPro cluster.

item.filter: PostgreSQL Statements: Amount of WAL Files

panels.title: Amount of WAL Files

panels.description:
Amount of WAL Records maps wal_records.

Statements metrics use information from pg_stat_statements and pg_stat_statements_info for PostgreSQL cluster and from pgpro_stats extension for PostgresPro cluster.

item.filter: PostgreSQL Statements: Amount of WAL Records

panels.title: Amount of WAL Records

panels.description:
Dirty Bytes calculates as summa of shared_blks_dirtied and local_blks_dirtied.

Statements metrics use information from pg_stat_statements and pg_stat_statements_info for PostgreSQL cluster and from pgpro_stats extension for PostgresPro cluster.
panels.title: Dirty Bytes

panels.description:
Read IO Time maps blk_read_time.

Statements metrics use information from pg_stat_statements and pg_stat_statements_info for PostgreSQL cluster and from pgpro_stats extension for PostgresPro cluster.
panels.title: Read IO Time

panels.description:
Write IO Time maps blk_write_time.

Statements metrics use information from pg_stat_statements and pg_stat_statements_info for PostgreSQL cluster and from pgpro_stats extension for PostgresPro cluster.
panels.title: Write IO Time

panels.description:
Other Time calculates as total_time - blk_read_time - blk_write_time.

Statements metrics use information from pg_stat_statements and pg_stat_statements_info for PostgreSQL cluster and from pgpro_stats extension for PostgresPro cluster.
panels.title: Other time

panels.description:
Read Speed calculates as shared_blks_read, local_blks_read and temp_blks_read.

Statements metrics use information from pg_stat_statements and pg_stat_statements_info for PostgreSQL cluster and from pgpro_stats extension for PostgresPro cluster.
panels.title: Read Speed

panels.description:
Write Speed calculates as summa of shared_blks_written and local_blks_written.

Statements metrics use information from pg_stat_statements and pg_stat_statements_info for PostgreSQL cluster and from pgpro_stats extension for PostgresPro cluster.
panels.title: Write Speed

panels.description:
WAL FPI maps wal_fpi.

Statements metrics use information from pg_stat_statements and pg_stat_statements_info for PostgreSQL cluster and from pgpro_stats extension for PostgresPro cluster.
panels.title: WAL Full Page Writes
